content.raw: Can you add an option that parallels the rotating snap shortcut for translation?  Formerly in gazebo, the user could only snap to the grid when translating so that’s why there wasn’t a need for one fully devoted to translating.
content.html: Can you add an option that parallels the rotating snap shortcut for translation? Formerly in gazebo, the user could only snap to the grid when translating so that’s why there wasn’t a need for one fully devoted to translating.

content.raw:
Looks great! I left a few comments.  I think that in the end, we will want to have tutorials separated by release and we should likely go ahead and start doing this now as the distinctions between the releases will likely become more and more noticeable as time progresses \(although we’re not too sure at this point in time, we already know of a few distinctions that will occur\).  
  
It’ll likely make tutorials easier to resolve in the future should two plugins behave differently from one another for whatever reason.  Also, Citadel will need tutorials that aren’t ever going to be available in Blueprint so I think that makes more of a case for separated tutorials.
content.html:
Looks great! I left a few comments. I think that in the end, we will want to have tutorials separated by release and we should likely go ahead and start doing this now as the distinctions between the releases will likely become more and more noticeable as time progresses (although we’re not too sure at this point in time, we already know of a few distinctions that will occur).

It’ll likely make tutorials easier to resolve in the future should two plugins behave differently from one another for whatever reason. Also, Citadel will need tutorials that aren’t ever going to be available in Blueprint so I think that makes more of a case for separated tutorials.

content.raw: @{5d114073a232e50bd6f26983} this is the only part of your review I had trouble with. The models you suggested wouldn’t load when dragged into the scene, and I couldn’t find anything open robotics related that would load without error. Do you have any other suggestions or maybe you could try loading the turtlebot or pr2 to double check?
content.html: @John Shepherd this is the only part of your review I had trouble with. The models you suggested wouldn’t load when dragged into the scene, and I couldn’t find anything open robotics related that would load without error. Do you have any other suggestions or maybe you could try loading the turtlebot or pr2 to double check?
